examples: I was recently divorced and feeling at a very low ebb.
I had just gotten divorced and it was what you do when you get divorced.
Or maybe it's a marriage and you get divorced.
Katie lives above the pub run by her divorced dad.
But thirties to fifties: lawyers, you want lawyer friends cause you're gonna, you're gonna get divorced.
words.defineEn: no longer married to someone because the marriage has been legally ended
words.defineVi: không còn kết hôn với ai đó vì cuộc hôn nhân đã kết thúc hợp pháp

examples: The new sofa wouldn't fit into the small living room.
His partner left the table in a fit of pique.
The teacher had a fit when the dog ran through the classroom.
Technology advances by fits and starts.
Replies to the advertisement are arriving in fits and starts.
words.defineEn: healthy and strong, especially due to regular physical exercise or balanced diet
words.defineVi: khỏe mạnh, đặc biệt là do tập thể dục thường xuyên hoặc chế độ ăn uống cân bằng

examples: The lost child was helped by a kind police officer to find their way home.
The hikers diligently searched the dense forest for the lost trail, using a map and compass as their guide.
Whenever I feel lost or uncertain, I turn to my favorite books, knowing that a book holds a house of gold that can provide guidance and inspiration.
And on Wall Street today, stocks made up some lost ground.
It's a lost cause.
words.defineEn: unable to find or recover something that is misplaced, vanished, or missing
words.defineVi: không thể tìm hoặc khôi phục thứ gì đó bị thất lạc, biến mất hoặc mất tích

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to have a certain physical sensation or mental impression
words.defineVi: để có một cảm giác vật lý nhất định hoặc ấn tượng tinh thần

examples: The plans for the new development have raised angry protests from local residents.
His angry glance said it all.
A hungry man is an angry man after all.
My grandmother got angry when I accidentally spilled juice on the carpet.
My boss was so angry that I really got the rough edge of his tongue.
words.defineEn: feeling very annoyed or upset because of something that we do not like
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất khó chịu hoặc khó chịu vì điều gì đó mà chúng tôi không thích

words.defineEn: to legally become someone's wife or husband
words.defineVi: để hợp pháp trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của một ai đó

examples: I was too nervous to eat.
I felt a bit nervous when the elevator suddenly stopped between floors.
I was nervous before my dental appointment, but the dentist made me feel comfortable.
He grew nervous about the deal and asked his bank manager to stop the cheque.
I was pretty nervous to start with, but after a while I was fine.
words.defineEn: worried and anxious about something or slightly afraid of it
words.defineVi: lo lắng và băn khoăn về điều gì đó hoặc hơi sợ điều đó

examples: I'll be ready in a minute.
I'm ready to start the process of writing.
I'm ready to drop!
The cookie dough is ready to be rolled into small balls and baked.
He's always ready to help at the drop of a dime.
words.defineEn: mentally or physically prepared for a situation or activity
words.defineVi: chuẩn bị tinh thần hoặc thể chất cho một tình huống hoặc hoạt động

examples: The idea was to better the prisoners, not to break them.
And bettering our lives.
If you didn't like it, SUGGEST BETTER PHRASES OF THE WEEK IN COMMENTS.
Both had a passion for bettering the community.
Let's Better Know: Henri Rousseau’s
words.defineEn: recovered from a physical or mental health problem completely or compared to the past
words.defineVi: phục hồi hoàn toàn từ một vấn đề sức khỏe thể chất hoặc tinh thần hoặc so với quá khứ

examples: I always come off worse when we argue.
I've always believed that praise makes good men better and bad men worse, because it can either motivate or inflate their egos.
He laughed at her and then, to make matters worse, he accused her of lying!
Even worse, those pores also give other toxins a way in.
Even worse, raccoons can transmit diseases like canine distemper and, in rare cases, rabies.
words.defineEn: having a lower standard, value, or quality than another thing or person
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn, giá trị hoặc chất lượng thấp hơn một thứ hoặc người khác

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: having a temperature lower than the human body's average temperature
words.defineVi: có nhiệt độ thấp hơn nhiệt độ trung bình của cơ thể con người

examples: His carelessness lost him the job.
Jobs that pay £5 an hour.
This job puts years on you.
My job is the tough one.
The team's new manager brings ten years' experience to the job.
words.defineEn: the work that we do regularly to earn money
words.defineVi: công việc mà chúng tôi làm thường xuyên để kiếm tiền

examples: The newspaper has an entertainment section with movie reviews and celebrity news.
All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
She reads the newspaper every day to keep up with the latest news.
I use the newspaper as a source for my research papers because it has reliable information.
The newspaper has a column where readers can write in and ask for advice.
words.defineEn: a printed publication or a set of large folded sheets of printed paper that contain news, articles, ads, etc., usually issued daily or weekly
words.defineVi: một ấn phẩm in hoặc một tập hợp các tờ giấy in lớn được gấp lại có chứa tin tức, bài báo, quảng cáo, v.v., thường được phát hành hàng ngày hoặc hàng tuần

examples: The tickets were £25.
Tickets for the concert are like gold dust.
The tickets are selling like hot cakes
The ticket for the bus is valid for a single journey.
They checked our tickets at the entrance of the stadium.
words.defineEn: a piece of paper, text, card, or image showing that we have paid to enter a place, travel with a public transport, etc.
words.defineVi: một mảnh giấy, văn bản, thẻ hoặc hình ảnh cho thấy chúng tôi đã trả tiền để vào một địa điểm, di chuyển bằng phương tiện công cộng, v.v.

examples: She got into the car.
The town itself has got into gear with a campaign to improve the environment.
Little kids get into everything, and it can really try your patience.
They got into trouble with the law for driving under the influence.
She got into trouble with her parents for staying out too late on school nights.
words.defineEn: to enter or reach a location
words.defineVi: để nhập hoặc tiếp cận một vị trí

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to enter a bus, ship, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để vào xe buýt, tàu, máy bay, v.v.

examples: Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Do me a favour and get off my back!
The concert tour didn't get off the ground until the band's new album was released and started gaining popularity.
The bus ground to a halt at the corner and someone got off.
It took a lot of hard work, but their business finally got off the ground.
words.defineEn: to leave a bus, train, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một chiếc xe buýt, xe lửa, máy bay, vv

examples: See my car?
Our car has seen better days!
A car hit the barrier.
My father's car needs an oil change.
The car was doing 90 miles an hour.
words.defineEn: a road vehicle that has four wheels, an engine, and a small number of seats for people
words.defineVi: một phương tiện giao thông đường bộ có bốn bánh, một động cơ và một số ít chỗ ngồi cho người

examples: Buses take priority over other vehicles on the road.
The bus hit the bridge.
The bus can take 60 passengers.
Buses to Oxford run every half hour.
A bus appeared around the corner.
words.defineEn: a large vehicle that carries many passengers by road
words.defineVi: một chiếc xe lớn chở nhiều hành khách bằng đường bộ

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to have a good, friendly, or smooth relationship with a person, group, or animal
words.defineVi: để có một mối quan hệ tốt, thân thiện, hoặc suôn sẻ với một người, nhóm, hoặc động vật

examples: It really gets up my nose.
He's just getting up my nose so much at the moment.
He got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
You, the night owl, are getting up at 5 AM tomorrow?
I got up and looked out of the window.
words.defineEn: to get on our feet and stand up
words.defineVi: để có được trên đôi chân của chúng tôi và đứng lên

examples: The policeman hammered home the dangers of drinking and driving.
My son is coming home soon.
The forest is home to a diverse range of plant and animal species.
I pressed the issue home to them.
To hit a home run.
words.defineEn: the place that we live in, usually with our family
words.defineVi: nơi mà chúng tôi sống, thường là với gia đình của chúng tôi

examples: Schools have welcomed such arrangements with open arms.
The school took the full force of the explosion.
She left school at 16.
Many schools don’t take full advantage of the Internet.
The kids always work hard at school.
words.defineEn: a place where children learn things from teachers
words.defineVi: một nơi mà trẻ em học những điều từ giáo viên

examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: something that we do regularly to earn money
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà chúng tôi làm thường xuyên để kiếm tiền

examples: The email went to everyone in the company.
I don't send emails blowing smoke up their asses.
I received an automated email from the accountant saying that she was out to lunch.
My coworker put her foot in it when she accidentally sent an email to the wrong person.
In the past, it was common to send handwritten letters but nowadays email is the preferred method of communication, other times, other manners.
words.defineEn: a digital message that is sent from one person to another person or group of people using a system called email
words.defineVi: một tin nhắn kỹ thuật số được gửi từ một người đến một người khác hoặc một nhóm người sử dụng một hệ thống gọi là email

examples: I'll send you a text message.
Text message scams are also illegal.
Text messages would be sent.
They send three, four, five anti-union text messages a day.
Text messages, Twitter, I might have even got a phone call.
words.defineEn: a written message that one sends or receives using a mobile phone
words.defineVi: một tin nhắn bằng văn bản mà một người gửi hoặc nhận bằng điện thoại di động

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
Bring Helen a present.
Bring a present for Helen.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
Our hosts presented us with an embarrassment of riches.
words.defineEn: something given to someone as a sign of appreciation or on a special occasion
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được trao cho ai đó như một dấu hiệu của sự đánh giá cao hoặc vào một dịp đặc biệt

examples: No prizes for guessing what she was wearing.
The exceptional taste of Temple oranges makes them a prized ingredient in gourmet recipes.
There are hundreds of prizes up for grabs.
There are hundreds of prizes to be won.
He didn't get the prize he expected, but never mind - that's the way the ball bounces.
words.defineEn: anything that is given as a reward to someone who has done very good work or to the winner of a contest, game of chance, etc.
words.defineVi: bất cứ thứ gì được trao như một phần thưởng cho người đã làm rất tốt hoặc cho người chiến thắng trong một cuộc thi, trò chơi may rủi, v.v.
